Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model

Class Book

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model.Book
public class Book
extends java.lang.Object
Book class models a book in the library.

The book has fields for different book properties such as title and author and also has an id field that represents the book's unique id in the library system. In addition, the class has a loan field of type Loan that holds information about a book that is on loan.

The class also offers getter and setter methods to get and set the values of the different properties and methods that change the status of the book when it gets borrowed or returned to the library.

See Also:
loan, Loan

  • Constructor Details

    • Book

      public Book​(int id, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String author, java.lang.String publicationYear)
      Create a new Book instance.

      The constructor initialises a Book object using the basic mandatory fields a book should have to exist in the library. Additional fields can be set after initialisation using the class's setter methods (e.g. setLoan(Loan) .

      Parameters:
      id - the book's id
      title - the book's title
      author - the book's author
      publicationYear - the book's publication year

    • getDetailsShort

      public java.lang.String getDetailsShort()
      Get short description for the book.

      The function returns a String containing the book's id and title in the following format: "Book #43 - The War of The Worlds".

      Returns:
      the book's short description as String

    • getDetailsLong

      public java.lang.String getDetailsLong()
      Get detailed info for the book.

      The function returns a String containing all the book's properties in the following format: 

       
 Book #43
 Title: The War of The Worlds
 Author: H.G. Wells
 Publication year: 1898
      In addition, if the book is on loan, the returned String should contain the name of the patron that has borrowed the book and the due date for the loan.
      Returns:
      detailed information about the book as String

    • isOnLoan

      public boolean isOnLoan()
      Check if the book is on loan.

      The function checks if the book has a Loan associated with it and returns the results.

      Returns:
      true if the book is on loan and false if the book is available

    • getStatus

      public java.lang.String getStatus()
      Get the book status.

      The function returns "On loan" if the book is on loan and "Available" if the book is available.

      Returns:
      the book status as String

    • getDueDate

      public java.time.LocalDate getDueDate()
      Get the due date of a book that is on loan.
      Returns:
      the due date of a book if the book is on loan

    • setDueDate

      public void setDueDate​(java.time.LocalDate dueDate) throws LibraryException
      Set the due date of a book.

      The function sets (changes) the due date of a book that is currently on loan. If the book is not on loan, an exception should be thrown, notifying the user that the due date can't be set because the book is not on loan.

      Parameters:
      dueDate - the LocalDate value that will be set as the book's due date
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if the book is not on loan

    • getLoan

      public Loan getLoan()
      Get the book's Loan object that holds information about a book that is on loan.
      Returns:
      the value of the book's loan field
      See Also:
      Loan

    • setLoan

      public void setLoan​(Loan loan)
      Get the book's Loan object that holds information about a book that is on loan.
      Parameters:
      loan - the Loan object to be set on the book

    • returnToLibrary

      public void returnToLibrary()
      Return the book to the library.

      This function is used to unset any loan information that exists for the book.
